Susan H. Briggs Receives 2017 Altec “All-Star Award”

4/5/2018

Susan H. Briggs, shareholder of Dickie, McCamey & Chilcote, P.C., was presented with the Altec “All-Star Award” 2017 at a meeting held on March 24, 2018, in Sea Island, Georgia.

Altec Industries presents this award annually to members of Altec legal panel counsel in recognition of best outcomes and representation. This is the second Altec “All-Star Award” Ms. Briggs has received for favorable results in the defense of workers’ compensation and employment law cases for Altec. She received her first “All-Star Award” for legal work performed in 2015.

Ms. Briggs is a Board Certified Specialist in workers’ compensation and has practiced law for over two decades. She serves on Dickie McCamey’s Executive Committee and is the Shareholder-in-Charge of the firm’s Charlotte, North Carolina, office. She received her Juris Doctor from the Univeristy of North Carolina School of Law.

# # #

About Dickie, McCamey & Chilcote, P.C.
Dickie, McCamey & Chilcote, P.C. is a nationally-recognized law firm providing comprehensive legal expertise in a multitude of practice areas. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, and founded more than 100 years ago, the firm serves industry-leading clients across the country from offices throughout the mid-Atlantic region in Pennsylvania, Delaware, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, South Carolina, West Virginia, the Southwestern region of California, and the Rocky Mountain region of Colorado. For more information: 800-243-5412 or www.dmclaw.com.

DMC Expands Its Medicare Compliance Team

4/3/2018

Dickie, McCamey & Chilcote, P.C., (DMC) a national, full-service law firm, is pleased to welcome Jessica L. Altobelli as an associate to its Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, office. She joins the Medicare Compliance Group.

Before joining Dickie McCamey, Ms. Altobelli worked as an in-house attorney at a local Medicare compliance firm where she drafted set-aside agreements. “We are fortunate to have Jessica join our team,” says Medicare Compliance Chair, Benjamin Basista. “Her background in analyzing medical history and forecasting future medical needs are an asset to our clients.”

Ms. Altobelli received her Juris Doctor from the Duquesne University School of Law and earned a Bachelor of Arts degree, cum laude, from the University of Pittsburgh. She is on the Board of Directors of Assemble, a nonprofit dedicated to providing on-ramps to Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics (STEAM) to the community.
